Darwen Trials Club - Affiliated to ACU
Supplementary Regulations for Novice Beginner Series - Event 1
PERMIT No.: ACU62342
DATE No.: 19th February, 2022
VENUE: Sweetwell House Farm, Todmorden Road, Briercliffe, Burnley

ANNOUNCEMENT: Darwen Trials Club will organise a Closed to Club Trial for solo motorcycles, held under the National Sporting Code, Standing Regulations of the ACU, the North Western Centre Rules current at the time, the following Supplementary Regulations and any Final Instructions issued for the meeting. In addition the event will follow the guidelines contained within the current Covid 19 Trials Risk Assessment.
Please take the time to carefully read any specific Safety Procedures produced by Darwen Trials Club which form part of the Supplementary Regulations. There will also be a Riders Briefing which all riders must attend ten minutes before the official start time.

ELIGIBILITY: This trial will be restricted to members of Darwen Trials Club only. All riders and passengers must hold a current ACU/SACU Trials Registration Card or ACU/SACU Competition Licence. Any rider or passenger from another FMN must produce a licence issued by their FMN, together with start permission and proof of personal accident insurance.

MACHINES: Motorcycles as per NSC Appendix D Category 1, Group A1 Solos and TSR 8.

START / VENUE: at Sweetwell House Farm, Todmorden Road, Briercliffe, Burnley - BB10 3PL

DIRECTIONS: From the M65 Leave the M65 - Junction 12 - following the A682 towards Nelson and Brierfield. At the first two roundabouts, take the first exit then turn right onto Lomeshaye Road. Take the first right to Hibson Road then left into Halifax Road. This will shortly become Todmorden Road. After a couple of miles, continue into Shay Lane then follow this to Sweetwell Boarding Kennels. From Holme Chapel After passing through Holme Chapel, leave the A646 on Red Lees Road to your right. Follow this for about a mile, then turn right into Salterford Lane. Follow this for around two miles, then turn right into Shay Lane following this to Sweetwell Boarding Kennels.

No practising on this land without the landowner\'s permission.

OFFICIALS:
Clerk of the Course:
Secretary of the Meeting: (To whom all correspondence regarding this event shall be addressed): Alex Sykes – alex@alexsykes.net
Point of Contact for Child Protection Matters: Secretary of the Meeting.

ENTRY FEES: Adult - , Under 16 – Entries through the ACU online system only. One-Day Licences may be obtained through the online system. Withdrawal of an entry may incur a £3 charge by the ACU.

RESULTS: Will be published on the trialmonster.uk website

COURSE: Will comprise one or more laps of a course all on private land. No practising on this land before or after the event. The number of laps and sections will be announced at a riders’ briefing immediately before the event start.

COURSES: Hard Novice, Novice, 50/50, Easy

CLASSES: Adult, Youth

METHOD OF MARKING & TIES: As per TSR22 Stop Permitted

PROTESTS: Protests by email only as per National Sporting Code of the ACU, section 10.04
